description: Change of use of the land to open storage (class B8) for temporary period up to 3 years.
decision_conditions: This permission shall be for a limited period only expiring on the 30th April 2026 on or before which date the use hereby permitted shall be discontinued, the buildings and works carried out under this permission shall be removed and the site reinstated to its former condition to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:
To enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved plans:
Site Location Plan dated 27th September 2022
Proposed heights zoning plan Rev -P00 dated 27th March 2023
ATV Tracking Plan ref. 14.1B, 14.2B, 14.3B, 15.1, 15.2
Planning, Design & Access Statement by Quod dated September 2022
Transport Statement by Iceni dated September 2022
Flood Risk Assessment by Rambell dated 13th September 2022
Noise Assessment by Tetra Tech dated December 2022
Air Quality Assessment by Tetra Tech dated 24th November 2022
Reason:
To enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control and in the interests of sustainable development.
The shipping containers shall be arranged and limited in height as per the approved Proposed heights zoning plan Rev -P00 dated 27th March 2023
Reason:-
In the interest of visual amenity and neighbouring amenity.
The site shall be used for the storage of shipping containers only and for the storage of no other items or materials.
Reason:-
To minimise the impact of the development on the surrounding area in the interests of amenity.

The development hereby approved shall operate between the hours of (08:00) and (18:00) Mondays to Fridays, between the hours of (08:00) and (13:00) on Saturdays, and not at any time on Sundays, Bank or Public Holidays.
Reason:-
To minimise the impact of the development on the surrounding area in the interests of amenity.

With the exception of emergency lighting, there shall be no external lighting unless details have first been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Any lighting shall require a "lighting design strategy for biodiversity" and this shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The strategy shall:

a)	identify those areas/features on site that are particularly sensitive for nocturnal species- and that are likely to cause disturbance in or around their breeding sites and resting places or along important routes used to access key areas of their territory, for example, for foraging; and

b)	show how and where external lighting will be installed (through provision of appropriate lighting contour plans and technical specifications) so that it can be clearly demonstrated that areas to be lit will not disturb or prevent the above species using their territory or having access to their breeding sites and resting places.
c)	All exte

Prior to the commencement of any development or use of the site, a noise impact assessment shall be undertaken of the impact of noise emanating from the hereby permitted use upon the neighbouring residential properties.

Reference should be made to the "good" standard to be found in the World Health Organisation Guidelines for Community Noise 1999 and BS8233:2014 Guidance on Sound Insulation and Noise Reduction for Buildings.

Following this, a scheme detailing mitigation measures, which are to protect neighbouring residential properties from noise from the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  It shall be implemented and validated prior to the site being brought into the hearby permitted use.
Reason: To protect the amenity of the occupants of neighbouring residential properties.

Prior to the commencement of any works on site, a detailed Dust Management Plan, shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority setting out dust and emissions control measures to be employed on site, in accordance with the Institute of Air Quality Management Guidance on the assessment of dust from demolition and construction.
Reason: To reduce emissions from the use of the site and to comply with policy SI 1 of the London Plan.
In the event of any material excavation works or material ground disturbance the developer shall submit for the written approval of the Local Planning Authority;
a) 	A Phase I (Desktop Study) Report documenting the history of the site, its surrounding area and the likelihood of contaminant/s, their type and extent incorporating a Site Conceptual Model.

A Phase II (Site Investigation) Report if the Phase I Report confirms the possibility of a significant risk to any sensitive receptors.  This is an intrusive site investigation including factors such as chemical testing, quantitative risk assessment and a description of the sites ground conditions.  An updated Site Conceptual Model should be included showing all the potential pollutant linkages and an assessment of risk to identified receptors.
